abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column asserts that the book Steve Jobs, Walter Isaacson's biography of the Apple Inc founder, lacks true insight despite being packed full of details and revelations; argues that more time is needed for biographers to be able to make sense of Jobs' amazing life.
snippet: In his biography of Steve Jobs, Walter Isaacson had difficulty getting the critical and historical distance he needed to take his subject’s true measure.
lead_paragraph: In his biography of Steve Jobs, Walter Isaacson had difficulty getting the critical and historical distance he needed to take his subject’s true measure.
